intro: Rhyticalymma ochroleucum, commonly known as the yellow-leafed daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features basal leaves that are oval and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and slightly hairy. The flowers are yellow with a central disk, and the plant typically blooms from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
